channel.title: Page Setup Features on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Page Setup Features on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Setting Page Options
item.description: Sometimes, it is necessary to configure page setup settings for worksheets to control printing. These page setup settings offer various options. Contents Summary 1 Setting Page Options 1.1 Page Orientation 1.2 Scaling Factor 1.3 FitToPages Options 1.4 Paper Size 1.5 Print Quality 1.6 First Page Number || Setting Page Options Page setup options are fully supported in Aspose.

item.title: Setting Margins
item.description: Aspose.Cells fully supports Microsoft Excel’s page setup options. Developers may need to configure page setup settings for worksheets to control the printing process. This topic discusses how to use Aspose.Cells to configure page margins. Contents Summary 1 Setting Margins 1.1 Page Margins 1.2 Center on Page 1.3 Header and Footer Margins || Setting Margins Aspose.Cells provides a class, Workbook, that represents an Excel file.

item.title: Setting Headers and Footers
item.description: Headers and footers are the lines of text displayed below the top margin or above the bottom margin respectively. It’s possible to add headers and footers to the worksheets also. Headers and footers can be used to display useful information like page number, author name, topic name, or date and time. Headers and footers are managed using the page setup settings. Contents Summary 1 Setting Headers and Footers 1.

item.title: Setting Print Options
item.description: Microsoft Excel’s page setup settings provide several print options (also referred to as sheet options) that allow users to control how worksheet pages are printed. Contents Summary 1 Setting Print Options 1.1 Set Print Area 1.2 Set Print Titles 1.3 Set Other Print Options 1.4 Set Page Order || Setting Print Options These print options allow users to:

item.title: Get Paper Width and Height of Page Setup of Worksheet
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Get Paper Width and Height of Page Setup of Worksheet 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output || Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes, you need to know the width and height of paper size as it has been set in page setup of the worksheet. Please use the PageSetup.PaperWidth and PageSetup.PaperHeight properties for this purpose.

item.title: Remove Existing PrinterSettings of Worksheets in Excel file
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Remove Existing PrinterSettings of Worksheets in Excel file 3 Screenshot 4 Sample Code 5 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes developers want to prevent Excel from including .bin files of printer settings in the saved XLSX files. Printer settings files are located under “[file “root”]\xl\printerSettings”. This document explains how to remove existing printer settings using Aspose.

item.title: Implement Custom Paper Size of Worksheet for Rendering
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Implement Custom Paper Size of Worksheet for Rendering 3 Screenshot 4 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios There is no direct option available to create custom paper sizes in MS Excel, however, you can set custom paper size of your desired worksheets when rendering Excel file to PDF file format. This document explains how to set a custom paper size of a worksheet using Aspose.

item.title: Copy Page Setup Settings from Source Worksheet into Destination Worksheet
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Copy Page Setup Settings from Source Worksheet into Destination Worksheet 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios When you add a new sheet to a workbook, it contains the default Page Setup settings. There may be times when you need to transfer the settings (PageSetup) from one worksheet to another worksheet.

item.title: Determine if Paper Size of Worksheet is Automatic
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Determine if Paper Size of Worksheet is Automatic 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios Most of the time, the paper size of the worksheet is automatic. When it is automatic, it is often set as Letter. Sometimes the user sets the paper size of the worksheet as per their requirements.
